package com.aadil.liquidglass.ui.screens

import android.graphics.Bitmap
import android.widget.Toast
import androidx.compose.foundation.Image
import androidx.compose.foundation.background
import androidx.compose.foundation.border
import androidx.compose.foundation.clickable
import androidx.compose.foundation.gestures.detectDragGestures

@OptIn(ExperimentalMaterial3Api::class)
@Composable
fun MainScreen(viewModel: EditorViewModel = viewModel()) {
 val wallpapers by viewModel.wallpapers.collectAsState()
 val selectedWallpaper by viewModel.selectedWallpaper.collectAsState()
 val context = LocalContext.current

 // THE FIX: We now use a simple if/else to switch between the grid and the full-screen editor.
 if (selectedWallpaper == null) {
 // Show the wallpaper grid if no wallpaper is selected
 Scaffold(
 topBar = {
 TopAppBar(
 title = { Text("Liquid Glass Wallpapers") },
 colors = TopAppBarDefaults.topAppBarColors(
 containerColor = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.primaryContainer,
 titleContentColor = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.primary
 )
 )
 }
 ) { paddingValues ->
 WallpaperGrid(
 wallpapers = wallpapers,
 onWallpaperClick = { wallpaper ->
 viewModel.selectWallpaper(wallpaper)
 },
 modifier = Modifier.padding(paddingValues)
 )
 }
 } else {
 // Show the full-screen editor when a wallpaper is selected
 FullScreenEditor(
 wallpaper = selectedWallpaper!!,
 viewModel = viewModel,
 onApply = { bitmap ->
 viewModel.setWallpaper(context, bitmap)
 viewModel.clearSelection() // Go back to the grid after applying
 },
 onBack = {
 viewModel.clearSelection() // Go back to the grid
 }
 )
 }
}

@Composable
fun WallpaperGrid(
 wallpapers: List<Wallpaper>,
 onWallpaperClick: (Wallpaper) -> Unit,
 modifier: Modifier = Modifier
) {
 LazyVerticalGrid(
 columns = GridCells.Fixed(2),
 modifier = modifier.padding(8.dp),
 verticalArrangement = Arrangement.spacedBy(8.dp),
 horizontalArrangement = Arrangement.spacedBy(8.dp)
 ) {
 items(wallpapers) { wallpaper ->
 Image(
 painter = painterResource(id = wallpaper.resourceId),
 contentDescription = "Wallpaper ${wallpaper.id}",
 contentScale = ContentScale.Crop,
 modifier = Modifier
 .aspectRatio(9f / 16f)
 .clip(RoundedCornerShape(12.dp))
 .clickable(
 interactionSource = remember { MutableInteractionSource() },
 indication = rememberRipple(),
 onClick = { onWallpaperClick(wallpaper) }
 )
 )
 }
 }
}


@OptIn(ExperimentalMaterial3Api::class)
@Composable
fun FullScreenEditor(
 wallpaper: Wallpaper,
 viewModel: EditorViewModel,
 onApply: (Bitmap) -> Unit,
 onBack: () -> Unit
) {
 val context = LocalContext.current
 val captureController = rememberCaptureController()
 val density = LocalDensity.current

 val blurRadius by viewModel.blurRadius.collectAsState()
 val glassAlpha by viewModel.glassAlpha.collectAsState()
 val refractionHeight by viewModel.refractionHeight.collectAsState()
 val refractionAmount by viewModel.refractionAmount.collectAsState()

 val providerState = rememberLiquidGlassProviderState(backgroundColor = Color.Black)
 val glassStyle = GlassStyle(
 shape = RoundedCornerShape(0.dp),
 innerRefraction = InnerRefraction(
 height = RefractionHeight(refractionHeight.dp),
 amount = RefractionAmount(refractionAmount.dp)
 ),
 material = GlassMaterial(
 blurRadius = blurRadius.dp,
 brush = SolidColor(Color.White),
 alpha = glassAlpha
 )
 )

 Scaffold(
 topBar = {
 TopAppBar(
 title = { Text("Edit & Crop Effect") },
 navigationIcon = {
 IconButton(onClick = onBack) {
 Icon(Icons.AutoMirrored.Filled.ArrowBack, contentDescription = "Back")
 }
 },
 actions = {
 IconButton(onClick = { captureController.capture() }) {
 Icon(Icons.Default.Check, contentDescription = "Apply Wallpaper")
 }
 },
 colors = TopAppBarDefaults.topAppBarColors(
 containerColor = Color.Transparent,
 titleContentColor = Color.White,
 actionIconContentColor = Color.White,
 navigationIconContentColor = Color.White
 )
 )
 }
 ) { paddingValues ->
 BoxWithConstraints(
 modifier = Modifier
 .fillMaxSize()
 .padding(paddingValues),
 contentAlignment = Alignment.Center
 ) {
 val constraintsWidth = constraints.maxWidth
 val constraintsHeight = constraints.maxHeight

 var selectionSize by remember { mutableStateOf(with(density) {
 androidx.compose.ui.geometry.Size(constraintsWidth * 0.5f, constraintsHeight * 0.4f)
 })}
 var selectionOffset by remember { mutableStateOf(Offset(
 constraintsWidth * 0.25f, constraintsHeight * 0.3f
 ))}

 Capturable(
 controller = captureController,
 onCaptured = { imageBitmap, error ->
 if (imageBitmap != null) {
 onApply(imageBitmap.asAndroidBitmap())
 } else {
 Toast.makeText(context, "Error capturing image.", Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show()
 error?.printStackTrace()
 }
 }
 ) {
 Box(modifier = Modifier.matchParentSize()) {
 Image(
 painter = painterResource(id = wallpaper.resourceId),
 contentDescription = "Background",
 contentScale = ContentScale.Crop,
 modifier = Modifier
 .matchParentSize()
 .liquidGlassProvider(providerState)
 )

 Box(
 modifier = Modifier
 .offset {
 IntOffset(
 selectionOffset.x.roundToInt(),
 selectionOffset.y.roundToInt()
 )
 }
 .size(
 width = with(density) { selectionSize.width.toDp() },
 height = with(density) { selectionSize.height.toDp() }
 )
 .liquidGlass(
 state = providerState,
 style = glassStyle
 )
 ) {
 Box(
 modifier = Modifier
 .matchParentSize()
 .border(2.dp, Color.White.copy(alpha = 0.7f))
 .pointerInput(Unit) {
 detectDragGestures { change, dragAmount ->
 change.consume()
 val newOffsetX =
 (selectionOffset.x + dragAmount.x)
 .coerceIn(0f, constraintsWidth - selectionSize.width)
 val newOffsetY =
 (selectionOffset.y + dragAmount.y)
 .coerceIn(0f, constraintsHeight - selectionSize.height)
 selectionOffset = Offset(newOffsetX, newOffsetY)
 }
 }
 )

 Box(
 modifier = Modifier
 .align(Alignment.BottomEnd)
 .size(24.dp)
 .offset(x = 12.dp, y = 12.dp)
 .background(Color.White.copy(alpha = 0.7f), CircleShape)
 .pointerInput(Unit) {
 detectDragGestures { change, dragAmount ->
 change.consume()
 val newWidth = (selectionSize.width + dragAmount.x)
 .coerceIn(100f, constraintsWidth - selectionOffset.x)
 val newHeight = (selectionSize.height + dragAmount.y)
 .coerceIn(100f, constraintsHeight - selectionOffset.y)
 selectionSize = androidx.compose.ui.geometry.Size(newWidth, newHeight)
 }
 }
 )
 }
 }
 }
 }

 // The sliders are now overlaid at the bottom of the full screen
 Column(
 modifier = Modifier
 .fillMaxSize()
 .padding(bottom = 32.dp),
 verticalArrangement = Arrangement.Bottom
 ) {
 Text(
 "Drag the box or use the handle to resize",
 modifier = Modifier.align(Alignment.CenterHorizontally),
 fontSize = 12.sp,
 color = Color.White.copy(alpha = 0.8f)
 )
 Spacer(Modifier.height(8.dp))

 EditorSlider("Blur Radius", blurRadius, 0f..50f) { viewModel.blurRadius.value = it }
 EditorSlider("Glass Opacity", glassAlpha, 0f..1f) { viewModel.glassAlpha.value = it }
 EditorSlider("Refraction Height", refractionHeight, 0f..50f) { viewModel.refractionHeight.value = it }
 EditorSlider("Refraction Amount", refractionAmount, -50f..50f) { viewModel.refractionAmount.value = it }
 }
 }
}


@Composable
private fun EditorSlider(
 label: String,
 value: Float,
 range: ClosedFloatingPointRange<Float>,
 onValueChange: (Float) -> Unit
) {
 Column(modifier = Modifier.padding(horizontal = 24.dp, vertical = 4.dp)) {
 Row(
 modifier = Modifier.fillMaxWidth(),
 horizontalArrangement = Arrangement.SpaceBetween
 ) {
 Text(label, fontWeight = FontWeight.Medium, color = Color.White)
 Text(String.format("%.1f", value), color = Color.White)
 }
 Slider(
 value = value,
 onValueChange = onValueChange,
 valueRange = range,
 colors = SliderDefaults.colors(
 thumbColor = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.primary,
 activeTrackColor = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.primary,
 inactiveTrackColor = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.secondaryContainer
 )
 )
 }
}

fun FullScreenEditor(

 viewModel: EditorViewModel,
 onApply: (Bitmap) -> Unit,
 onBack: () -> Unit
) {

 val captureController = rememberCaptureController()
 val density = LocalDensity.current
 val scope = rememberCoroutineScope()

 val blurRadius by viewModel.blurRadius.collectAsState()

 val refractionHeight by viewModel.refractionHeight.collectAsState()
 val refractionAmount by viewModel.refractionAmount.collectAsState()
 val cornerRadius by viewModel.cornerRadius.collectAsState()

 val glassStyle = GlassStyle(
 shape = RoundedCornerShape(cornerRadius.dp),
 innerRefraction = InnerRefraction(
 height = RefractionHeight(refractionHeight.dp),
 amount = RefractionAmount(refractionAmount.dp)
 ),
 material = GlassMaterial(
 blurRadius = blurRadius.dp,
 brush = SolidColor(Color.White),
 alpha = glassAlpha
 )
 )

 topBar = {
 TopAppBar(
 title = { Text("Edit & Crop Effect") },
 navigationIcon = {
 IconButton(onClick = onBack) {
 Icon(Icons.AutoMirrored.Filled.ArrowBack, contentDescription = "Back")
 }
 },
 actions = {
 IconButton(onClick = {
 scope.launch {
 delay(100)
 captureController.capture()
 }
 }) {
 Icon(Icons.Default.Check, contentDescription = "Apply Wallpaper")
 }
 },
 colors = TopAppBarDefaults.topAppBarColors(
 containerColor = Color.Transparent,
 titleContentColor = Color.White,
 actionIconContentColor = Color.White,
 navigationIconContentColor = Color.White
 )
 )
 },
 containerColor = Color.Black
 ) { paddingValues ->
 Box(

 .fillMaxSize()
 .padding(paddingValues)
 ) {
 Capturable(

@Composable
fun BoxScope.ResizeHandle(
 alignment: Alignment,
 onDrag: (Offset) -> Unit
) {
 Box(
 modifier = Modifier
 .align(alignment)
 .size(32.dp)
 .offset(
 x = if (alignment.toString().contains("End")) 16.dp else (-16).dp,
 y = if (alignment.toString().contains("Bottom")) 16.dp else (-16).dp
 )
 .background(Color.Transparent, CircleShape)
 .pointerInput(Unit) {
 detectDragGestures { change, dragAmount ->
 change.consume()
 onDrag(dragAmount)
 }
 }
 )
}


@Composable
private fun EditorSlider(
 label: String,
 value: Float,
 range: ClosedFloatingPointRange<Float>,
 onValueChange: (Float) -> Unit
) {
 Column(modifier = Modifier.padding(horizontal = 24.dp, vertical = 4.dp)) {
 Row(
 modifier = Modifier.fillMaxWidth(),
 horizontalArrangement = Arrangement.SpaceBetween
 ) {
 Text(label, fontWeight = FontWeight.Medium, color = Color.White)
 Text(String.format("%.1f", value), color = Color.White)
 }
 Slider(
 value = value,
 onValueChange = onValueChange,
 valueRange = range,
 colors = SliderDefaults.colors(
 thumbColor = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.primary,
 activeTrackColor = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.primary,
 inactiveTrackColor = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.secondaryContainer
 )
 )
 }
}

@OptIn(ExperimentalMaterial3Api::class)
@Composable
fun MainScreen(viewModel: EditorViewModel = viewModel()) {
 val wallpapers by viewModel.wallpapers.collectAsState()
 val selectedWallpaper by viewModel.selectedWallpaper.collectAsState()
 val context = LocalContext.current

 if (selectedWallpaper == null) {
 Scaffold(
 topBar = {
 TopAppBar(
 title = { Text("Liquid Glass Wallpapers") },
 colors = TopAppBarDefaults.topAppBarColors(
 containerColor = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.primaryContainer,
 titleContentColor = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.primary
 )
 )
 }
 ) { paddingValues ->
 WallpaperGrid(
 wallpapers = wallpapers,
 onWallpaperClick = { wallpaper ->
 viewModel.selectWallpaper(wallpaper)
 },
 modifier = Modifier.padding(paddingValues)
 )
 }
 } else {
 FullScreenEditor(
 wallpaper = selectedWallpaper!!,
 viewModel = viewModel,
 onApply = { bitmap ->
 viewModel.setWallpaper(context, bitmap)
 viewModel.clearSelection()
 },
 onBack = {
 viewModel.clearSelection()
 }
 )
 }
}

@Composable
fun WallpaperGrid(
 wallpapers: List<Wallpaper>,
 onWallpaperClick: (Wallpaper) -> Unit,
 modifier: Modifier = Modifier
) {
 LazyVerticalGrid(
 columns = GridCells.Fixed(2),
 modifier = modifier.padding(8.dp),
 verticalArrangement = Arrangement.spacedBy(8.dp),
 horizontalArrangement = Arrangement.spacedBy(8.dp)
 ) {
 items(wallpapers) { wallpaper ->
 Image(
 painter = painterResource(id = wallpaper.resourceId),
 contentDescription = "Wallpaper ${wallpaper.id}",
 contentScale = ContentScale.Crop,
 modifier = Modifier
 .aspectRatio(9f / 16f)
 .clip(RoundedCornerShape(12.dp))
 .clickable(
 interactionSource = remember { MutableInteractionSource() },
 indication = rememberRipple(),
 onClick = { onWallpaperClick(wallpaper) }
 )
 )
 }
 }
}

 val newHeight = (selectionSize.height + dragAmount.y).coerceIn(100f, constraintsHeight - selectionOffset.y)
 selectionOffset = Offset(newOffsetX, selectionOffset.y)
 selectionSize = Size(newWidth, newHeight)
 }
 ResizeHandle(alignment = Alignment.BottomEnd) { dragAmount ->
 val newWidth = (selectionSize.width + dragAmount.x).coerceIn(100f, constraintsWidth - selectionOffset.x)
 val newHeight = (selectionSize.height + dragAmount.y).coerceIn(100f, constraintsHeight - selectionOffset.y)
 selectionSize = Size(newWidth, newHeight)
 }
 }
 }
 }

 Column(
 modifier = Modifier
 .align(Alignment.BottomCenter)
 .fillMaxWidth()
 .padding(bottom = 32.dp)
 ) {
 Text(
 "Drag the box or use the handles to resize",
 modifier = Modifier.align(Alignment.CenterHorizontally),
 fontSize = 12.sp,
 color = Color.White.copy(alpha = 0.8f)
 )
 Spacer(Modifier.height(8.dp))

 EditorSlider("Blur Radius", blurRadius, 0f..50f) { viewModel.blurRadius.value = it }
 EditorSlider("Glass Opacity", glassAlpha, 0f..1f) {
 viewModel.glassAlpha.value = it
 }
 EditorSlider(
 "Refraction Height",
 refractionHeight,
 0f..50f
 ) { viewModel.refractionHeight.value = it }

 "Refraction Amount",

 -50f..0f
 ) { viewModel.refractionAmount.value = it }
 EditorSlider(
 "Corner Radius",
 cornerRadius,
 0f..50f
 ) { viewModel.cornerRadius.value = it }
 }
 }
 }
}

@Composable
fun BoxScope.ResizeHandle(
 alignment: Alignment,
 onDrag: (Offset) -> Unit
) {
 Box(
 modifier = Modifier
 .align(alignment)
 .size(32.dp)
 .offset(
 x = if (alignment.toString().contains("End")) 16.dp else (-16).dp,
 y = if (alignment.toString().contains("Bottom")) 16.dp else (-16).dp
 )
 .background(Color.Transparent, CircleShape)
 .pointerInput(Unit) {
 detectDragGestures { change, dragAmount ->
 change.consume()
 onDrag(dragAmount)
 }
 }
 )
}


@Composable
private fun EditorSlider(
 label: String,
 value: Float,
 range: ClosedFloatingPointRange<Float>,
 onValueChange: (Float) -> Unit
) {
 Column(modifier = Modifier.padding(horizontal = 24.dp, vertical = 4.dp)) {
 Row(
 modifier = Modifier.fillMaxWidth(),
 horizontalArrangement = Arrangement.SpaceBetween
 ) {
 Text(label, fontWeight = FontWeight.Medium, color = Color.White)
 Text(String.format("%.1f", value), color = Color.White)
 }
 Slider(
 value = value,
 onValueChange = onValueChange,
 valueRange = range,
 colors = SliderDefaults.colors(
 thumbColor = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.primary,
 activeTrackColor = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.primary,
 inactiveTrackColor = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.secondaryContainer
 )
 )
 }
}

- The capture is triggered immediately; with Compose + shader-based effects, a frame delay alone may not ensure the provider has re-rendered with new uniforms.

Concise fix
- Make the glass style and provider state stable across recompositions.
- Force one post-frame pass after the latest slider change before capturing.
- Ensure the capture includes only the effect region you see or the whole layout including the effect, but with updated uniforms.

What to change
1) Hoist and remember glass style inputs and provider:
- Keep provider from being recreated.
- Build GlassStyle within remember and update via derivedStateOf so it’s consistent when captured.

2) Add a “settle” flag and post-frame barrier before capture:
- Wait for a frame after the last slider change so the provider has applied new params.
- Then trigger capture.

How to implement (concise steps)
- Wrap GlassStyle creation in remember/derivedStateOf.
- Track a “pendingChange” flag that is set on any slider change, then cleared after a LaunchedEffect with a frame delay.
- Only allow capture when pendingChange == false, or in the capture action, await the next frame explicitly.

 alpha = glassAlpha
 )

 )

 - var pendingChange by remember { mutableStateOf(false) }
 - Whenever a slider changes, set pendingChange = true alongside updating the viewModel value.
 - LaunchedEffect(blurRadius, glassAlpha, refractionHeight, refractionAmount, cornerRadius) {
 // wait for next frame so liquidGlass updates its uniforms
 withFrameNanos { } 
 pendingChange = false
 }
- In the Apply (tick) action:
 - scope.launch {
 // If there was a recent slider change, wait a frame so effect is actually drawn
 withFrameNanos { }
 captureController.capture()
 }

Why this works
- The provider and style are stable and not recreated at odd times.
- The post-frame wait guarantees the shader/effect has rendered with latest params before the pixel buffer is captured.
- The capture then includes the updated blur, alpha, refraction, and corner radius.

Optional improvement
